page.title: 12A DAIRY FARM
page.content: Most of the work on the farm is connected with the cows which have to be milked twice a day. Milking the cows involves wetting the dairy floor, taking the cows into the dairy,milking them, letting them back into the field and finally cleaning all the cow muck out of the dairy. This has to be done both morning and afternoon. Occasionally the farmer muck out the sheds, spreads muck on the fields, puts silage into the cow kennels, makes hay and silage, bags silage and stacks hay. The farmer also has to mend fencing and keep records, which involves writing the names of the cows,their numbers and how much milk they have given. Most of the work is done by machine, such as tractors and bailers.
